abstract: Federal Judge Lewis A Kaplan, presiding over Manhattan trial of Khalid al-Fawwaz for his role in 1998 Al Qaeda bombings of American embassies in Nairobi, Kenya, and Dar es Salaam, Tanzania, rejects defense lawyers' request to bar testimony from government witnesses.
lead_paragraph: Lawyers representing Khaled al-Fawwaz had argued that testimony from victims of the bombings would add nothing more than “dramatics” and “emotions” to the proceedings.
snippet: Lawyers representing Khaled al-Fawwaz had argued that testimony from victims of the bombings would add nothing more than “dramatics” and “emotions” to the proceedings.

headline.main: Survivors of 1998 U.S. Embassy Bombings Can Testify in Trial, Judge Rules
headline.print_headline: Survivors of 1998 U.S. Embassy Bombings Can Testify in Trial, Judge Rules
